sentences.english: He burst into the room red-faced and out of breath .
sentences.chinese: 他冲进房间，脸色通红，气喘吁吁。

sentences.english: His face was sallow and shiny with sweat.
Gog saw the gun and his face went white.
sentences.chinese: 高格看见了那支枪，脸色煞白。

sentences.english: The Wang Shi lip Yi moved several bottoms, didn't talk, but the facial expression is aggrieved.
sentences.chinese: 王氏嘴唇翳动了几下，没有说话，脸色却忿忿不平。

sentences.english: Lying in the emergency room looking pale.
sentences.chinese: 躺在急诊室的她脸色看起很苍白。

sentences.english: As oxygen flooded into Herring's lungs, her color returned.
sentences.chinese: 当氧气输入海岭的肺部时，她的脸色渐趋正常。

sentences.english: On hearing that, her face went white to the lips.
sentences.chinese: 一听那话她脸色登时变得苍白，直白到嘴唇了。

sentences.english: To mother's facial expression mortified, lower the brain.
sentences.chinese: 向妈妈脸色尴尬，低下头去。

sentences.english: Though her face was sallow, her cheeks were red.
sentences.chinese: 她脸色青黄，但两颊却还是红的。

sentences.english: Her face had turned a milky yellow colour.
The passengers turned quite green with sea- sickness .
sentences.chinese: 旅客们由于晕船而脸色发青。

sentences.english: Marguerite, extremely pale and with her mouth half open, was trying to catch her breath.
sentences.chinese: 玛格丽特的脸色苍白，嘴半张着，竭力想喘过气来。

sentences.english: Her face blanched with fear at the news of her daughter's accident.
sentences.chinese: 听到她女儿发生车祸的消息她吓得脸色刷白。
吴荪甫的脸色突然变了。

sentences.english: Give me it"the sea pumice submerge down facial expression."
sentences.chinese: 把它给我”海浮石沉下脸色。

definition: to have heard what was said
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
to turn one's head/to turn around
self-respect of old person/face/thick-skinned (i.e. impervious to criticism)/brazen
